example.eg: Tim has lost some of the pieces of his puzzle and can't complete the picture.
example.egtrans: 提姆搞丢了拼图玩具的几片，没法完成拼图了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 拼图玩具, 七巧板玩具

example.eg: Daisy enjoys doing puzzles; it keeps her mind active.
example.egtrans: 黛西喜欢解谜题，这能让她保持头脑活跃。

example.eg: I really don't know where your keys could be; it certainly is a puzzle.
example.egtrans: 我真的不知道你的钥匙能在哪里；你钥匙的下落真是个难题。

example.eg: The strange sounds in the night puzzled Archie; he wondered what they could be.
example.egtrans: 夜晚奇怪的声音让阿尔奇困惑不已，他想知道那是什么声音。

example.eg: Malcolm behaves very strangely and he's secretive, so you have no idea why; he's a real puzzle.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 让人搞不懂的人, 令人费解的人

example.eg: Anita was lost in thought, puzzling over how to tell her boss she had made a huge mistake.
Since he had been away for the summer, he was puzzled over his high utility bills.
He puzzled over the equation for weeks before finally finding the solution.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 为…伤脑筋, 为…苦思冥想

dsense.name: acrostic, acrostic puzzle
dsense.guideword: (word puzzle using initials) (类似于藏头诗或藏尾诗的一种诗体)

example.eg: Many people enjoy the New York Times crossword puzzle.
I don't have the time to sit and do a jigsaw.
example.egtrans: 我没时间闲坐着拼拼图。

example.eg: 100-piece jigsaw puzzles are easy, but a 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle takes days to put together.
